page.title: 10Customs.The Raft Race.
page.content: On August Bank Holiday Monday, it is a tradition in Newport,for teams from various local clubs,to make and enter a raft for the annual raft race on the canal.Stalls are situated by the side of the canal selling all manner of produce.People are encouraged to buy small bags of flour to throw at the teams as they paddle the rafts towards the finishing line.A greasy pole put across the canal,results in friendly pushing with some people falling into the canal. The local riding school brings ponies to give rides.To add to the carnival scene,decorated floats are driven through the village.They are decorated by local organizations,such as the Brownies.The festival day finishes with a fancy dress disco in the recreation hall in the evening.The day raises money for local charities.
